stance.audience: Households preparing for water outages in apartments or homes
stance.promise: A simple time ladder to size, store, and maintain safe water

claims_checklist: Explain 72h, 2w, 30d+ ladder and per-person daily volume
Quantify volumes for a 2-person and 4-person household per rung
Call out hidden sources: hot water cylinder, toilet cistern (not for drinking), ice, pipes
Include rotation doctrine: label, date, 6–12 months
Include at least 3 authoritative sources and 1 forum insight

quotes.quote: Store at least one gallon per person per day for three days.
Emergency disinfection of drinking water can be done with household bleach.
A typical 40–50 gallon hot water tank can be a backup water source if isolated and drawn safely.
Many apartment preppers keep 5-gallon stackables under beds and couches to distribute weight.
